remarks: Define the set of _left-regular elements_ in a ring as those elements which are not left zero divisors, meaning that multiplying a nonzero element on the left by a left-regular element gives a nonzero product. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Mar-2015.)
statement:
df-rlreg $p |- RLReg = ( r e. _V |-> { x e. ( Base ` r ) | A. y e. ( Base ` r ) ( ( x ( .r ` r ) y ) = ( 0g ` r ) -> y = ( 0g ` r ) ) } ) $.
$d r x y $.
